Package pulse.search.math

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • pulse.search.math.Matrix
  • public final class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object

    A class used to represent small matrices, generally used in optimisation. Hence, instead of implementing advanced decomposition methods for calculating the determinant and the inverted matrix, it relies on simpler techniques, such as the Laplace expansion.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Matrix​(double[][] args)
      Constructs a Matrix copying the contents of args.
      Matrix​(int n)
      Constructs a square matrix of the size n.
      Matrix​(int n, double f)
      Constructs a square Matrix, where the non-diagonal elements are zero, and diagonal elements are each equal to f.
      Matrix​(Vector... args)
      Constructs a matrix (not necessarily square), where args are mapped to different columns, thus the Vector components are mapped into different rows.

      Calculates the cofactor Aij=(-1)(i+1)+(j+1)Mij of this matrix using row = i and column = j.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(Vector... args)

        Constructs a matrix (not necessarily square), where args are mapped to different columns, thus the Vector components are mapped into different rows. In case if the args.length == 1, the Matrix will represent a transposed Vector, i.e. a column vector.

        Parameters:
        args - one or multiple vectors

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(int n)
        Constructs a square matrix of the size n.
        Parameters:
        n - the size of the square matrix.

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(double[][] args)
        Constructs a Matrix copying the contents of args.
        Parameters:
        args - a two-dimensional array

      • Matrix

        public Matrix​(int n,
              double f)
        Constructs a square Matrix, where the non-diagonal elements are zero, and diagonal elements are each equal to f.
        Parameters:
        n - the size of the square Matrix
        f - a numeric value

    • Method Detail

      • sum

        public Matrix sum​(Matrix m)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Checks whether both this and m have matching dimensions. If true, will perform an element-wise summation.

        Parameters:
        m - another Matrix of the same size as this one
        Returns:
        a Matrix with elements formed as the result of summing up the respective elements in this and m
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the dimensions of the matrices do not match

      • subtract

        public Matrix subtract​(Matrix m)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Checks whether both this and m have matching dimensions. If true, will perform an element-wise subtraction.

        Parameters:
        m - another Matrix of the same size as this one
        Returns:
        a Matrix with elements formed as the result of subtracting an element of matrix m from the respective element in this
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the dimensions of the matrices do not match

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply​(Matrix m)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

        Performs Matrix multiplication. Checks whether the dimensions of each matrix are appropriate (number of columns in this matrix should be equal to the number of rows in m.

        Parameters:
        m - another Matrix suitable for multiplication
        Returns:
        a Matrix, which is the result of multiplying this by m
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the number of columns in this matrix is not equal to the number of rows in m

      • multiply

        public Matrix multiply​(double f)
        Scales this Matrix by f, which results in element-wise multiplication by f.
        Parameters:
        f - a numeric value
        Returns:
        the scaled Matrix

      • multiply

        public Vector multiply​(Vector v)

        Multiplies this Matrix by the vector v, which is represented by a n x 1 Matrix, where n is the dimension of v. Note n should be equal to the number of rows in this Matrix.

        Parameters:
        v - a Vector.
        Returns:
        the result of multiplication, which is a Vector.

      • transpose

        public Matrix transpose()
        Transposes this Matrix, i.e. reflects it over the main diagonal.
        Returns:
        a transposed Matrix

      • det

        public double det()
        Calculates the determinant for an n-by-n square matrix.

        If the matrix dimension is less than 3, the calculation is straightforward according to simplified formulae. Otherwise, a Laplace expansion will be used.

        Returns:
        a double, representing the determinant
        See Also:
        detLaplace()

      • detLaplace

        public double detLaplace()
        Calculates the determinant from the first row of this Matrix using the value of cofactors.
        Returns:
        the determinant.

      • inverse

        public Matrix inverse()
        Inverts the n-by-n Matrix using an adjugate matrix and the determinant of this matrix.
        Returns:
        the inverted .
        See Also:
        det(), adjugate()

      • submatrix

        public Matrix submatrix​(int row,
                        int column)
        Calculates a submatrix by eliminating the row and column from this Matrix
        Parameters:
        row - the row number, starting from 0
        column - the column number, starting from 0
        Returns:
        a submatrix of this one

      • adjugate

        public Matrix adjugate()
        Constructs an adjugate Matrix, the elements of which are aij=Aji, where Aij are the cofactors of this Matrix
        Returns:
        an adjugate Matrix

      • minor

        public double minor​(int row,
                    int column)
        Calculates the minor Mij of this matrix using row = i and column = j.
        Parameters:
        row - the row number, starting from 0
        column - the column number, starting from 0
        Returns:
        the Mij value

      • cofactor

        public double cofactor​(int row,
                       int column)
        Calculates the cofactor Aij=(-1)(i+1)+(j+1)Mij of this matrix using row = i and column = j.
        Parameters:
        row - the row number, starting from 0
        column - the column number, starting from 0
        Returns:
        the cofactor value

        public static Matrix outerProduct​(Vector a,
                                  Vector b)
        Calculates the outer product of two vectors, which is represented as a * bT
        Parameters:
        a - a Vector
        b - a Vector
        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Prints out matrix dimensions and all the elements contained in it.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • hasSameDimensions

        public boolean hasSameDimensions​(Matrix m)
        Checks if the dimension of this Matrix and m match, i.e. if the number of rows is the same and the number of columns is the same
        Parameters:
        m - another Matrix
        Returns:
        true if the dimensions match, false otherwise.
